comment: Only grades are lab reports and the lowest is dropped. No quizzes, tests, or final! Class ends before the end of semester.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Her lectures are extremely helpful and the study guides given are similar to test and even have extra credit questions at the end. Hw also helpful to be ready for tests.

Great professor. Makes physics easy. I relied heavily on the breakout session practice problems and in-class examples to study for the exam. I recommend that you come to class and write down her examples. She is extremely sweet and understanding. The math and conceptualization is really easy but granted I like math.

Dr. Padukka was great. She cares about her students and wants to make sure everyone understands the content. The tests are just like study guides and each test has a bonus question. It can sometimes be a little hard to understand her but she doesn't mind going back to re-explain. She was great
tests are straight forward. she's great for visual learners. you can use notes on quizzes

At the beginning of all of her labs, she goes over the lab with everyone and gives you all the formulas you need to complete the lab. She is very helpful and engaged throughout the lab. Labs are due at the beginning of the next lab, although most of the labs are completed during the time allotted for the lab. NO EXAMS :)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: The best professor at Kennesaw State University! Really caring for the student and understands it as long as you email her with your problems. She's one of the best professors at KSU and she's head of the department so she understands your problem. I will take her again she's really nice.

Although Professor Prabha is a great professor overall and she is very thorough with her lectures; some of her grading needs to change as well as the study guides and homework do not completely reflect the material on the exams. Homework is definitely harder than it has to be and she does not give a lot of extra credit as others claim. STUDY STUDY!

Professor Padukka was an amazing teacher. Anyone who says the class is beyond hard has barely any functioning brain cells.Although the homework is harder than the tests, they help you prepare for it. She drops a test and a quiz. Just go to lecture and you will need very little study time. Take her if you can.

I took her after being online for a year and I loved her class! She is really nice and gives you an extension on the HW if you need it. If you try your best and let her know what's going on, she will help you the most she can. If you can, take her!
Very good professor who explains each lab step-by-step and is available for questions. Super kind lady who is always willing to help. Definitely recommend. Easy Grader.

Tests are straightforward and she is willing to answer any questions you have. Does offer a lot of extra credit and tries her best to make everyone happy. I really enjoyed how much she cares about her students.

I am so bad at math but ended with a B in the class. Her tests are doable but the homework is twice as hard as the tests. The HW does not help with studying and is a waste of time. She does like 10 quizzes, 4 tests and 1 is dropped from each category. She is really nice and will work with you. She does not reply to emails very quickly. Extra credit

I think the class is harder than it needs to be when in an online format. Easy to fall behind. Make sure your schedule isn't very busy when taking physics because this class sucks up alot of time. I recommend her because she's a great teacher, I just don't recommend physics online because most of it will be you trying to teach yourself.

Probably the worst teacher I have ever had at any level. She did not care that I was struggling she just said she was too busy and to email my questions. I made all As in every class this semester except for hers. Her tests are beyond hard and have no resemblance to the homework, study guide, or extra practice. DO NOT TAKE if you don't have to.

Dr. Padukka is such a nice lady and seems to genuinely care about her students. Class is tough, but study well, review homework, and ATTEND IN-CLASS LECTURE (gives many problems similar to test questions) and you will succeed. Gives study guides for every test. Drops lowest of 4 tests. Pre and post quizzes for each chapter. Lots of graded work.

She's super nice and understanding! You will have to work for ur grade and there's a ton of hw. But if u pace urself it'll be fine. Ask questions bc she does a good job of explaining. In the end she did give us a good amount of extra cred opportunities.
Great professor very understanding in case you miss an assignment. Homework due at the end of each month. Pre quizzes are not a grade in this class.

I took her in the Spring and dropped because the format of the class was not good. I took her this summer and the class was so much better. It had great format, it made so much more sense, and the class was super easy to get through. Highly recommend her. She is super sweet and really wants her students to do well

I took Professor Padukka for physics 1111 & 1112. She is amazing! Gives great feedback, explains things clearly, lectures aren't too bad. 4 exams and a final that is made up of the previous exam questions, cengage homework (kind of a lot but its good practice for exams), and a super nice person. Study hard and you will do well. Overall great prof!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Although she was a very kind professor, I found this class to be incredibly difficult in the online format. She rarely answered my emails and I could not seem to schedule a time to meet with her outside our usual class time. I would spend 20+ hours a week studying and still be unsuccessful, which seems impractical for a beginner's course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: love her, she's so nice and willing to meet other than office hours. 4 tests, lowest dropped. 10 quizzes, lowest dropped. Webassign hw due every sunday, but its not a lot- sometimes 5 questions, sometimes 10 or 11. Cumulative final-study guide given which was similar to the test. in lab-8 but 1 dropped. simple,easy lab

Professor Padukka is a great professor. After I failed a test, she offered to meet with me on Zoom for individual help outside of her office hours because I worked each day it was offered. I thought that was so nice of her. (the failure was completely my fault, she is a great teacher.) If you do the work and pay attention in class you will pass.

Oh my gosh, She is such a breath of fresh air at KSU. Her prelab lecture is ACTUALLY USEFUL. She will answer her emails for any questions!! she is incredibly nice too! TAKE HER FOR PHYS 2211 LAB OR ANYTHING HONESTLY. She actually wants to help you!!

She is by far the best professor in the entire university. Professor Padukka genuinely cares about the grade of each student, and absolutely never loses patience, which is incredibly difficult because she was asked to constantly repeat herself all semester. She goes above and beyond for the success of her students, despite her crazy busy schedule.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This professor really goes above and beyond on making a tough course learnable for everyone. She is understanding if physics or math is not your strongest suit and puts in extra time to make sure you feel comfortable with the material. She also doesnt go to fast, for slower learners like myself. I would take her for any classes you possibly can.

Dr. Padukka is an amazing professor that instructs with clear, understandable and beneficial lectures. She will do as much as she can to be sure the students succeed and clearly understand the material. Her lab is fun and makes lecture even more understandable. Defiantly do whatever you can to take her classes!

Fantastic prof. I failed physics last semester w/ different prof and couldnt explain a single concept. Padukka makes everything so simple and clear so not only can you work problems you also understand the concept itself. Open note quizzes, allows notecards for tests, replaces lowest test with final exam grade, hw is online and is reasonable.

One of my favorite teachers at KSU! She is very caring, super helpful, & very friendly. The content is not the easiest, but she will help you til you get it if you ask! She is very approachable, & she gives great homework to prepare for tests. I hardly studied & made A's! Just go to class & do all the practice during the lectures!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Padukka is such an easy physics professor, she MAKES sure you know the material and will spend a long time going over review questions. She is slow to upload things on d2l however. Phys1111 is easy as it is, and she gives a lot of hw, a huge equation sheet on every test, easy recitation quizzes, and drops a test grade.

Dr. Padukka is a very supportive teacher. Lectures can be a lot, but as long as you follow along you're fine. She has pretty simple tests, curves them, and works really hard to help bring up student's grades. Attendance is not mandatory but if you skip you will miss a lot. The textbook isnt very helpful but you need it for Webassign.

I had her for physics 1 lab and she is fantastic. her pre lab lectures tell you exactly how to do the math for every question in the lab report. she is very helpful and grades very leniently. i'm terrible at math and will likely not pass physics lecture (different prof!) but have made > 90 on every lab report. highly recommend!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Very easy lab grader. Explains each procedure before class; I never read the lab manual once. Answers all questions as you go through the lab and even looks over your data before you turn it in an effort to catch any glaring errors- allows you to redo parts of the lab if need be. I would 100% recommend her!

It was easy, it was lab. Show up, DO the thing, turn it in. She graded pretty easy, tho if you did get points docked she didn't explain why (like "This looks wrong"). Sometimes hard to understand, but if you have questions she answers and helps you. Very clear, she tries hard.
I would say this is a mediocre class. She gives a clear outline of whats expected, she gives you bonuses non the tests, and your lowest test is dropped.

Professor Padukka is just like any profesor but where she raises above is her willing spirit to break it down to make sure you understand the fundamental concept of the subject your learning. i could not have asked for a better physics professor.

I have never taken physics before ,but after taking it with Dr. Padukka I really enjoys it now. She gives webassign homework for every chapter, and if you can do those questions then you are pretty prepared for her tests. She has a lot of office hours during the week, and if you go ask her questions she is extremely helpful. Overall she's great!

Dr. Padukka is a great lab professor! Just go and do the labs, do your report, and you will probably get an A. She gives all the equations you need at the start of the lab and will help you so it's super easy!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Grade is primarily based on tests, but doesn't tell you what will be on the test. The practice problems from lecture/recitation don't prepare you for the test, and the homework is even worse. No study guide or past exams given. She does drop one test and quiz grade. She is also fairly scattered in her lectures; jumps around and makes mistakes

easy lab. gives instructions and equations before you start. doesn't care about sig figs. lowest I've ever made on lab report was 90. Drops one lab but I think that's standard. Allows you to turn in labs late but she does take off points for lateness. but points off is better than a 0.

Very nice lady, and she wants you to do well. There are no test reviews or study guides and it's a toss up what will be on the tests. Unfortunately her tests are out of 16 points so I missed 3 points through the whole test and made a 78 with her random rounding (up or down). She does curve sometimes, recitations are good. Wish there was test review
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Requires attendance to recitations through quizzes. I learned the most by doing homework, but the lectures helped a little. She would have to correct herself quite a bit, so be prepared to think for yourself a little bit. She drops a quiz and test, which is helpful. Got a 50 on the first test, did lots of homework, then got a 100 on the second.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Excellent prof.!
She is willing to help you, within the rules. Tests are easy as long as you work through and review your handouts she gives you.

Pretty much makes it impossible to make below a B. Grades your tests in one of two ways, using the way that results in the highest grade on an individual basis.  Curves on top of that too. And after all that, if you're still failing, you have the option of doing an extra credit assignment to bring your grade up to as high as 80. Also very helpful.
